challenges.name: Intro to Machine Learning
challenges.description: Ever wonder how things like Siri and Google assistant are able to talk to us and do things for us, or how YouTube and Instagram suggests images and videos for you based on things that you watched and like, or maybe how cars can drive themselves? This is all done with something called Machine learning. Machine learning is this idea that computers learn based on data. Data is all around us, companies collect many data, then using it they can use algorithms based on math to make a machine predict things based on that data. Computers do not need to be programmed to do things, but instead could be fed data that they could learn with and get better with over time as more people use the service. There is 3 types of machine learning, Supervised Learning, Unsupervised Learning, and Reinforcement Learning.

challenges.name: How does machine learning work?
challenges.description: Wonder how that not-hotdog predictor works? It works by taking thousands of images of hotdogs and a mathematical algorithm that lets the computer learn what a hotdog looks like. This way, it can detect if there is a hotdog in the image based on the images fed to it. It took ______ images to train the predictor and it can get better the more it is used as more images are fed into the algorithm. Traditionally, if we wanted to build something to recognize a hotdog we would have to put the details of a hotdog and tell the computer every little detail, such as the colours, the shapes, etc. With machine learning the computer can learn from images instead of telling it exactly what a hotdog looks like. Similar to how us humans learn from our surroundings. In this course we learn more about these algorithms and make our own!

challenges.name: What are the different types of machine learning?
challenges.description: There are 3 different types of machine learning. Supervised Learning, Unsupervised Learning, and reinforcement learning.

challenges.name: Intro to Linear Regression
challenges.description: The first algorithm we are going to take a look at is Linear Regression. We can use linear regression to predict prices. PUT IMAGE Linear regression plots a line through number data points, that way to you can plot a line through data points that represent 2 parameters. For example, making a house price predictor you can plot a line through data that represents square feet and the actual price. That way we can input square feet and get a prediction on the price. Linear regression is supervised learning because the data is labeled. First thing we want to do is add an import function WORK ON IMPORT FUNCTION INSTRUCTIONS AND ADD IMAGES

challenges.name: Set up X and Y data
challenges.description: We have 2 sets of data the X data and the y data. The X data is going to be the information about the house (square feet) and the y plot is going to be the actual answer that we will train our model on.

challenges.name: Split the Train and Test size
challenges.description:
Whenever we make a machine learning model, we need to split the data into a training set and a testing set
This means, we feed the computer the training data so it learns from it and then we test how good the computer can recognize whatever we find.

challenges.name: Check Accuracy
challenges.description: Now that we finished our model we can check the accuracy of our algorithm! Using the accuracy function set it up to see if it we good a good accuracy and make sure that you set it to regression.

challenges.name: Conclusion
challenges.description: Now that we finished our house predictor we can test it out! Try placing a number in square feet and see what it ends up predicting
